U9iSNmJOt5kL5i21-LDfEw.text: My family & I love this restaurant & also known as Golden Spoon. Die die must try their famous signature dish, crab with bee hoon soup. The soup is so tasty & the crab is fresh. Their appetiser - deep fried oyster roll with mayo is delicious, too. We love their fresh fish & vegetables & as if we're dining in one of the good restaurants in Hongkong. Noticed lots of expatriates dining in this restaurant. The boss told me that he has lots of dining places & Red House Seafood is one of them. Prices are reasonable. This restaurant is always packed & so is their car-park lots. Worth your calories.

dOPehni0nnuaylZjRaQAnQ.text: A classic tze char restaurant with competent food and reasonable prices to boot. Tried their signature crab bee hoon and it was on point. Crab was big and fresh and fleshy. The stock was robust with wok hei and the bee hoon soaked them all up. The coffee pork ribs were very aromatic and well marinated and the HK steam fish (we took soon hock) was fresh and steamed just nice. Service was fast and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore. Coffee ribs
Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore. Signature crab bee hoon

VVoVEDuEJt_O1C2Z8zF-Ew.text: It's been a while since I've been here. I stayed away after hearing news that the chef was different, but came back cos apparently he's back. The crab beehoon was still good. I liked the gravy A LOT. Some must orders: crispy squid and their crispy tofu. Both were standout dishes that got everyone in my party fighting for thirds. Haha

photos.caption: Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore. One of the best crunchy baby squid I've ever had. They use rojak sauce!!!
Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore. So goooooooooood!!!!!!!! Crispy tofu with crunchy bits.
Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore. Prawn paste chicken

yZshRfy4WQri-Y7bot1e-w.text: A fairly typical Chinese restaurant serving up the usual dishes, the one reason why I keep going back to Golden Spoon is for their crabs, specifically their Crab Bee Hoon. Located in the heart of Tiong Bahru, near the market, parking is relatively easy as there are a lot of lots to be found just in front of the restaurant. The only issues I have are with the staff, who don't really seem to understand you, so patience is definitely required. One thing to note when dining, especially when you're going for the signature Crab Beehoon, is that the later you go, the higher the chances are that you'll end up with only the larger crabs left. Meaning if you're planning on going on a date, its best to get there early to choose a smaller crab or you'll end up like me having a 1.8kg crab to share with my friend, which honestly, is a little too big!

photos.caption: Photo of De Classic Golden Spoon - Singapore, Singapore

fYl6LJgF4zQDrBh_DQXqOw.text: Great crab bee hoon. Although I have to admit, I haven't had crab bee hoon anywhere else, I can't imagine it being any better than this anywhere else. Another hidden gem is the cereal tofu - think cereal prawns, but with less cholesterol. Chunks of egg tofu coated in garlicky corn flakes and deep fried, but the kicker is the sweet pumpkin sauce underneath. You don't get that with the prawns, and it's great. I just found out that this isn't even on the menu anymore, but they'll still make it if you ask.

Ct3zgLxO0Et1UhwAIPZ19A.text: Another one of my local favorites. The chilli crab is really good here, and is the mee goreng. I also tend to order the famous crab bee hoon, but for me it's slightly inconsistent- sometimes good, sometimes not memorable. The drunken prawns are another of my favorite orders here, and my wife, loves them. The broth is strong, and the prawns very fresh. The pumpkin sauce tofu is also delicious. There is much more seating outside than inside, and sometimes the fact that it is right in the car park might be irksome. Once, during the the height of CNY, they set up a tented area next to their restaurant, and the breeze was very welcome there. Also, BYOB is free. Highly recommended.

o1pR0gE64G4Pjw8l8xHo6g.text: Update based on a visit a few weeks ago: the crab bee hoon unfortunately lacked a rich crab flavor.  The crab itself was tender and sweet, but the bee hoon was lacking salt or something.  The cereal tofu is also now an off menu item.  It is still one of the best dishes here (my out of town friend agreed)!

ZEqNb2s3tEOiOW38y6bH9A.text: Came to Singapore for chili crab and was not disappointed. Taste just like I remembered it. And the rest of their seafood is delicious and fresh too. A little tricky to find, but plenty of parking.

yAyMPJ6XD3pjY0L-O4-aFQ.text: For this Chinese restaurant, it is recommended to make reservation at least a few hours before. Waited sometime for the table but it's was all worth it! Food came out promptly and service was good despite the huge crowd.Crab bee hoon: soup is really tasty and blends really well with the bee hoon. The crab is really fresh and big. Their most popular dish.Thai style pig trotter: one of the best I've eaten. The sauce is not too sweet and goes really well with the crispy skin and tender, juicy meat. A must try!Cereal tofu with pumpkin sauce: cereal is very crispy. Egg tofu fried in cubes. The creamy pumpkin sauce has a tinge of sweetness which blends perfectly with the cereal and tofu. Another awesome dish here.

bb4fB3m5543AiS_572H3Rg.text: Really really really good crab bee hoon!!! It looks like like crab sitting in a bowl of dirty water with noodles but its excellent! I've been back twice in the last month for the bee hoon!  Cereal prawns are also a must order!
